holidays.name: National Beverage Day
holidays.description: A day to raise your glass and celebrate all kinds of drinks, from water and coffee to exotic juices and fancy cocktails.
holidays.origin: Unofficially created by social media users to honor the importance of refreshing beverages in our daily lives.
holidays.funFact: Millions celebrate by trying out new beverages, and soda companies often launch limited edition flavors on this day!

holidays.name: No Diet Day
holidays.description: An annual reminder to embrace body positivity and take a break from dieting culture ‚Äî eat what you love without guilt!
holidays.origin: Started in 1992 by British journalist Mary Evans Young to promote awareness against unrealistic beauty standards.
holidays.funFact: No Diet Day encourages self-acceptance, making it a favorite ‚Äòcheat day‚Äô for many, even if unofficially!

holidays.name: Space Day
holidays.description: A celebration of space exploration, astronomy, and everything cosmic to inspire curiosity about the universe.
holidays.origin: Created by educational organizations in the 1990s to promote STEM learning and interest in space science.
holidays.funFact: Many planetariums and space museums offer free admission or special events on Space Day to fuel starry-eyed dreams.

holidays.name: Morse Code Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the invention of Morse code, the groundbreaking communication technology using dots and dashes.
holidays.origin: Marks the birthday of Samuel Morse, born on May 6, 1791, who developed this system revolutionizing long-distance communication.
holidays.funFact: During World War II, Morse code operators could send messages faster than teletypes, helping win many battles.
